group_1.textRight: So where to next?

group_1.textLeft: To the Suitoku Temple,@to visit the Tokime Clan.

group_1.textRight: Oh, you mean that huge shrine!

group_1.textLeft: Some time ago, when I was making preparations@for Rabi’s birthday,
the Tokime girls were of tremendous@help to me.
Though, there is something that@worries me…
Huh?
A gift of Christmas sweets, for our temple…?
We’ll take it, thanks!

group_1.textRight: Oh, I'm glad.

group_1.textLeft: We did just have a party, after all.

group_1.textRight: You had a party?
I was under the assumption that this temple@didn’t subscribe to the same traditions…
I guess I was worried over nothing.

group_1.textLeft: Things around here aren’t as restrictive@as people usually think they are.

group_1.textRight: I didn’t really understand it at first,@but I found it to be very enjoyable!

group_1.textLeft: That's very accepting of you, Shizuka.

group_1.textRight: So what kind of party did you have?

group_1.textLeft: What kind of…? Simply the usual kind;@chatting over a meal.

group_1.textRight: And after that, we even exchanged presents.
So you had presents!@I’m sure that was fun!

group_1.textLeft: We observed each other’s routines
and we picked out presents that we@thought the other would enjoy.
Since we all live together,@that’s what we went with.

group_1.textRight: It works precisely because you’re@together… I envy that a bit.

group_1.textLeft: The thing is, we wait until the day comes@to find out who we’ll be giving our gift to.
So, because of that, we had to just give@things that we would like ourselves...

group_1.textRight: I feel like it went pretty well,@with no one being a prick about it.
I got a mystery novel about a Diviner@protagonist from Chiharu.
I’m still in the middle of readin’ it,@but it’s hella fun.

group_1.textLeft: Really?! I’m so glad!@That one has a sequel, y’know!
I also can’t wait to use the massage@coupon you got me, Ryouko.

group_1.textRight: Good, I’ll get you to unwind real good.
I got a set of camo-printed loungewear@from Asahi.
They’ll come in very handy for my@routine in the mountains!

group_1.textLeft: I received some jerky from Miss Chika.
It had a very different scent and texture@compared to chicken; I enjoyed it very much.

group_1.textRight: I’m not as sure that my present was well liked…

group_1.textLeft: I did enjoy the train photobook you gave me.
The natural landscapes and the warmth of the@people who live there really got to me.

group_1.textRight: Yes, you get it!
The way that amalgamation of metal cuts through@the abundance of green is incredible!

group_1.textLeft: Speaking of which, how was the T-shirt@I gave you…?

group_1.textRight: I’ll get right to wearing it tomorrow!
It has that so-called creepy-cute thing@that's been trending recently, right?
I’ll make sure to keep that in mind,@thank you!

group_1.textLeft: I wasn’t going for a creepy-cute shirt@at all, though.
But if makes Shizuka happy,@then that’s all that matters!

group_1.textCenter: (Gifting each other presents based on@their preferences...)
(They’re all very pleased by it… I envy how@wholesome their relationships are…)
…Oh no, would you look at the time.

group_1.textLeft: Mikage, we should get going…

group_1.textRight: Oh, right.

group_1.textLeft: On your way already?
We gotta say our thanks before you leave, then.

group_1.textCenter: Thank you for gifting us these sweets!

group_1.textLeft: Of course, you’re very welcome.
